column5: Great pics.... those were the good ole days... makes me wanna go hunting.., so I guess I will!
Love the shots of the deer and camp my friend.   I too have some old shots of stringers of bass.  Thanks for sharing.
Thanks Dr. Sal!!!   Thanks Nipfisher!!!  Yes I have a lot of different ones for different season   Thanks Drew!!!   Thanks TJ!!!  Yeah I miss them days.... good luck with the hunt
Thanks Brian!!!  Hows the bird hunt going??
Nice assortment of photos.Some photos are just priceless. One question....Is there a shortage of shavers in Quebec?lol
Thanks Johnny!!!  What you talkin about    hahahaha LOL  That's just my fall season look
Great post Jacques Cheers from another Quebecois!
Right on Erik Merci mon ami
I know but there are alot of people sporting that look in the pictures. Must get really cold in Quebec.lol
Yeah it gets pretty dam cold up here in the North    It's the norm and a must for hunting

Haven't been posting reports much this season but thought I'd share some pics of the past..... this goes back into early 90's..... the good old days  I was going through my photo albums yesterday and thought I'd share some..... well maybe a lot   Had to scan them to upload to Photobucket and didn't think there was that many     But for what it's worth..... sharing is what the intent is and hope you guys enjoy  First pic is the hunting portable camp my dad and I build for deer hunting..... it was 16' x 20' x 9'1/2, in 4'x 8' panels that was secured with bolts..... no floor required.... just plastic tarp and carpet    Here's another shot of it, all painted and hanging is my first buck    Inside was nice and causy..... notice the man on the far right, my dad, my best friend that taught me the great outdoors    This next pic is me and my daughter with my first buck when we got back from the bush and she was excited to see rudolph that close    The next photos are from different season but one that I truly enjoy is this one of my dad and I with my second buck    and another favorite of mine with my bro and dad    This one we were getting ready to cook deer liver from the kill.... oignons, bacon and patatoes was on the menu    My brother's first deer    another shot of the camp    and another    Now that does it for hunting..... into fishing Well not quite Had some huge rocks removed from the back yard to make place for a shed.... daughter posing after they were removed    Building the shed    The crew    and the end results    OK now onto fishing.... I promise  Ice fishing is what I truly enjoy and in my younger days was a real fanatic about it..... didn't matter what temperature, I was all out enjoying freedom  Here's me and a friend of mine.... notice the big fish on the stringer in front of me     first biggest eye that I got mounted    Here's the mount    next is a sturgeon I caught.... 49"   and here I'm trying to hold it but he didn't like it    Now that he was behaving    Specks on ice are my favorite's    and double headers doesn't happen often    Next few pics are random....    How bout it for running & gunning      Limit of walleyes    Softwater shots random.... Goin Reservoire, a few        My biggest eye up there    and the take home lunch    A couple of stringer shots with the brother in law      Well that is it, and hope you guys enjoy Tight lines Leechman
Simply awesome!
That's quite a collection of photos Jacque. Thanks for takin' the time.
Great pics and great memories I bet.
Really cool Jacques.  Thanks for taking the time to scan and post those.  Joey
Thanks Dusky!!!   Thanks Rob!!!  Glad you liked them   Thanks WeedLine!!!  They sure are
Thanks Jo-Anne!!!  Congrats again to the both of you on your wedding
Really cool blast to the past. That's a nice collection and good memories.
Thanks Rod Caster!!!  Best memories ever
very cool Leechman.... where is the camp at?  Do you still have it?
Thanks splashhopper!!!  We sold the camp a few years back and it's still being used for moose hunting
Nice bunch of photos man.  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
awesome pictures congrats go out to all of you
Thanks Mike!!!   Thanks Corvy!!!
Very cool Jacques!  Those sturgeon pics are super cool to the max!  I want to catch one now.  You should of kissed it on the lips.LOL
LOL Thanks Mike!!!  That was the last thing on my mind  but I could of
The years have been very kind to you Jacques!
That was a blast from the past... wasn't even my past and I still enjoyed it!  Looks like fun man! I hope to have pictures of me and my kids like that to look back on.
Thanks Simon!!!  They sure have   Thanks TC10Z!!!  It sure was
T'as une maudite belle barbe mon grand!!  L'Auberge Pepin me rappelle des souvenirs d'enfance de notre vieu camp de chasse..  Gros merci!

Merci Fidel!!!  Ont était situés près du lac Pépin just en dehors du Zec St-Patrice au Nord de Fort Coulonge..... une cristi belle place pour placer notre camp    Le pite de sable nous protègait complètement du vent  C'était surper!!!  La pancarte a été dessiné par mon beau-père free hand.... beaucoup de bon souvenirs de ce camp là
Mets-en!!
that's a really cool report.  cool to see all the old pics!    thanks!
Jaques, You have had quite an impressive hat collection.
Cool stuff Jacques.  Thanks for posting.
